title: Dandiya Raas
hero_image_alt: Dancers clashing sticks in Dandiya Raas
short_description: The playful stick dance representing the mock fight between Goddess Durga and Mahishasura.
long_description:
Dandiya Raas is the traditional folk dance of Gujarat and Rajasthan performed during Navratri. It involves men and women dancing with colorful wooden sticks (dandiyas) in their hands. The striking of sticks creates a rhythmic accompaniment to the music. 

Symbolically, it represents the battle between Goddess Durga and the demon Mahishasura (the sticks represent swords). It is slightly different from Garba, which is hand-clapping and singing, though both are performed at the same events.

practical_info.audience_tips: Bring your own sticks or buy at venue.

seo_title: Dandiya Raas Guide: The Stick Dance of Gujarat
seo_description: Play Dandiya Raas, the energetic stick dance of Gujarat. Symbolizing the battle of Durga, performed during Navratri.

json_ld_template.headline: Dandiya Raas: The Rhythm of Sticks
